snippet: The settlement, which was filed Thursday in Federal District Court in Manhattan, deals a big blow to an industry that in recent years fed off a recessionary rise in consumer debt actions.
abstract: About 75,000 New Yorkers who had their wages garnished or bank accounts frozen in debt-collection scheme will be awarded $59 million in class-action settlement; decision deals blow to industry dependent on recession-driven consumer debt and offers hope to others burdened by fraudulent default judgements.
lead_paragraph: The settlement, which was filed Thursday in Federal District Court in Manhattan, deals a big blow to an industry that in recent years fed off a recessionary rise in consumer debt actions.

headline.main: Victims of Debt Collection Scheme in New York Win $59 Million in Settlement
headline.print_headline: Victims of Debt-Collection Scheme Receive $59 Million in Lawsuit Settlement
